  16. (* Compiling C files and building C libraries *)

  18. ‌let command cmdline =
  19.   if !Clflags.verbose then begin
  20.     prerr_string "+ ";
  21.     prerr_string cmdline;
  22.     prerr_newline()
  23.   end;
  24.   let res = Sys.command cmdline in
  25.   if res = 127 then raise (Sys_error cmdline);
  26.   res

  28. ‌let run_command cmdline = ignore(command cmdline)

  30. (* Build @responsefile to work around OS limitations on
  31.    command-line length.
  32.    Under Windows, the max length is 8187 minus the length of the
  33.    COMSPEC variable (or 7 if it's not set).  To be on the safe side,
  34.    we'll use a response file if we need to pass 4096 or more bytes of
  35.    arguments.
  36.    For Unix-like systems, the threshold is 2^16 (64 KiB), which is
  37.    within the lowest observed limits (2^17 per argument under Linux;
  38.    between 70000 and 80000 for macOS).
  39. *)

  41. ‌let build_response_file lst =
  42.   let (responsefile, oc) = Filename.open_temp_file "camlresp" "" in
  43.   List.iter (fun f -> Printf.fprintf oc "%s\n" f) lst;
  44.   close_out oc;
  45.   at_exit (fun () -> Misc.remove_file responsefile);
  46.   "@" ^ responsefile

  48. let quote_files ~response_files lst =
  49.   let lst = List.filter (fun f -> f <> "") lst in
  50. ‌  let quoted = List.map Filename.quote lst in
  51. ‌  let s = String.concat " " quoted in
  52.   if response_files &&
  53.   (String.length s >= 65536
  54.   || (String.length s >= 4096 && Sys.os_type = "Win32"))
  55.   then build_response_file quoted
  56.   else s

  58. ‌let quote_prefixed ~response_files pr lst =
  59.   let lst = List.filter (fun f -> f <> "") lst in
  60.   let lst = List.map (fun f -> pr ^ f) lst in
  61.   quote_files ~response_files lst

  63. ‌let quote_optfile = function
  64.   | None -> ""
  65.   | Some f -> Filename.quote f

  67. ‌let display_msvc_output file name =
  68.   let c = open_in file in
  69.   try
  70.     let first = input_line c in
  71.     if first <> Filename.basename name then
  72.       print_endline first;
  73.     while true do
  74.       print_endline (input_line c)
  75.     done
  76.   with _ ->
  77.     close_in c;
  78.     Sys.remove file

  80. ‌let compile_file ?output ?(opt="") ?stable_name name =
  81.   let (pipe, file) =
  82.     if Config.ccomp_type = "msvc" && not !Clflags.verbose then
  83.       try
  84.         let (t, c) = Filename.open_temp_file "msvc" "stdout" in
  85.         close_out c;
  86.         (Printf.sprintf " > %s" (Filename.quote t), t)
  87.       with _ ->
  88.         ("", "")
  89.     else
  90.       ("", "") in
  91. ‌  let debug_prefix_map =
  92.     match stable_name with
  93.     | Some stable when Config.c_has_debug_prefix_map ->
  94.       Printf.sprintf " -fdebug-prefix-map=%s=%s" name stable
  95.     | Some _ | None -> "" in
  96. ‌  let exit =
  97.     command
  98.       (Printf.sprintf
  99.          "%s%s %s %s -c %s %s %s %s %s%s"
  100.          (match !Clflags.c_compiler with
  101.           | Some cc -> cc
  102.           | None ->
  103.               (* #7678: ocamlopt only calls the C compiler to process .c files
  104.                  from the command line, and the behaviour between
  105.                  ocamlc/ocamlopt should be identical. *)
  106.               (String.concat " " [Config.c_compiler;
  107.                                   Config.ocamlc_cflags;
  108.                                   Config.ocamlc_cppflags]))
  109.          debug_prefix_map
  110.          (match output with
  111.           | None -> ""
  112.           | Some o -> Printf.sprintf "%s%s" Config.c_output_obj o)
  113.          opt
  114.          (if !Clflags.debug && Config.ccomp_type <> "msvc" then "-g" else "")
  115.          (String.concat " " (List.rev !Clflags.all_ccopts))
  116.          (quote_prefixed ~response_files:true "-I"
  117.             (List.map (Misc.expand_directory Config.standard_library)
  118.                (List.rev !Clflags.include_dirs)))
  119.          (Clflags.std_include_flag "-I")
  120.          (Filename.quote name)
  121.          (* cl tediously includes the name of the C file as the first thing it
  122.             outputs (in fairness, the tedious thing is that there's no switch to
  123.             disable this behaviour). In the absence of the Unix module, use
  124.             a temporary file to filter the output (cannot pipe the output to a
  125.             filter because this removes the exit status of cl, which is wanted.
  126.           *)
  127.          pipe) in
  128.   if pipe <> ""
  129.   then display_msvc_output file name;
  130.   exit

  132. ‌let create_archive archive file_list =
  133.   Misc.remove_file archive;
  134.   let quoted_archive = Filename.quote archive in
  135.   if file_list = [] then
  136.     0 (* Don't call the archiver: #6550/#1094/#9011 *)
  137.   else
  138.     match Config.ccomp_type with
  139.       "msvc" ->
  140.         command(Printf.sprintf "link /lib /nologo /out:%s %s"
  141.                                quoted_archive
  142.                                (quote_files ~response_files:true file_list))
  143.     | _ ->
  144.         assert(String.length Config.ar > 0);
  145.         command(Printf.sprintf "%s rc %s %s"
  146.                 Config.ar quoted_archive
  147.                 (quote_files ~response_files:Config.ar_supports_response_files
  148.                   file_list))

  150. ‌let expand_libname cclibs =
  151.   cclibs |> List.map (fun cclib ->
  152.     if String.starts_with ~prefix:"-l" cclib then
  153.       let libname =
  154.         "lib" ^ String.sub cclib 2 (String.length cclib - 2) ^ Config.ext_lib in
  155.       try
  156.         Load_path.find libname
  157.       with Not_found ->
  158.         libname
  159.     else cclib)

  161. ‌type link_mode =
  162.   | Exe
  163.   | Dll
  164.   | MainDll
  165.   | Partial

  167. ‌let remove_Wl cclibs =
  168.   cclibs |> List.map (fun cclib ->
  169.     (* -Wl,-foo,bar -> -foo bar *)
  170.     if String.length cclib >= 4 && "-Wl," = String.sub cclib 0 4 then
  171.       String.map (function ',' -> ' ' | c -> c)
  172.                  (String.sub cclib 4 (String.length cclib - 4))
  173.     else cclib)

  175. let call_linker mode output_name files extra =
  176.   Profile.record_call "c-linker" (fun () ->
  177.     let cmd =
  178.       if mode = Partial then
  179.         let (l_prefix, files) =
  180.           match Config.ccomp_type with
  181.           | "msvc" -> ("/libpath:", expand_libname files)
  182.           | _ -> ("-L", files)
  183.         in
  184.         Printf.sprintf "%s%s %s %s %s"
  185.           Config.native_pack_linker
  186.           (Filename.quote output_name)
  187.           (quote_prefixed ~response_files:true
  188.             l_prefix (Load_path.get_paths ()))
  189.           (quote_files ~response_files:true (remove_Wl files))
  190.           extra
  191.       else
  192.         Printf.sprintf "%s -o %s %s %s %s %s %s"
  193.           (match !Clflags.c_compiler, mode with
  194.           | Some cc, _ -> cc
  195.           | None, Exe -> Config.mkexe
  196.           | None, Dll -> Config.mkdll
  197.           | None, MainDll -> Config.mkmaindll
  198.           | None, Partial -> assert false
  199.           )
  200.           (Filename.quote output_name)
  201.           ""  (*(Clflags.std_include_flag "-I")*)
  202.           (quote_prefixed ~response_files:true "-L" (Load_path.get_paths ()))
  203.           (String.concat " " (List.rev !Clflags.all_ccopts))
  204.           (quote_files ~response_files:true files)
  205.           extra
  206.     in
  207.     command cmd
  208.   )

  210. ‌let linker_is_flexlink =
  211.   (* Config.mkexe, Config.mkdll and Config.mkmaindll are all flexlink
  212.      invocations for the native Windows ports and for Cygwin, if shared library
  213.      support is enabled. *)
  214.   Sys.win32 || Config.supports_shared_libraries && Sys.cygwin
